workflow.name: Automate multilingual Slack communication (JA ‚áÑ EN) with Gemini 2.5 Flash
workflow.description:
## üß† How it works  
This workflow automatically translates messages between **Japanese** and **English** inside Slack ‚Äî perfect for mixed-language teams.  
In our real-world use case, our 8-person team includes **Arif**, an English-speaking teammate from Indonesia, while the rest mainly speak Japanese.  

Before using this workflow, our daily chat often included:  
- ‚ÄúCan someone translate this for Arif?‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt understand what Arif wrote ‚Äî can someone summarize it in Japanese?‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúI need to post this announcement in both languages, but I don‚Äôt know the English phrasing.‚Äù  

This workflow fixes that communication gap **without forcing anyone to change how they talk**.  
Built with **n8n** and **Google Gemini 2.5 Flash**, it automatically detects the input language, translates to the opposite one, and posts the result **in the same thread**, keeping every channel clear and contextual.


## ‚öôÔ∏è Features  
- Unified translation system with **three Slack triggers**:  
  1Ô∏è‚É£ **Slash Command `/trans`** ‚Äì bilingual posts for announcements.  
  2Ô∏è‚É£ **Mention Trigger `@trans`** ‚Äì real-time thread translation for team discussions.  
  3Ô∏è‚É£ **Reaction üáØüáµ / üá∫üá∏** ‚Äì personal translation view for readers.  
- Automatic JA ‚Üî EN detection and translation via **Gemini 2.5 Flash**  
- 3-second instant **ACK** to satisfy Slack‚Äôs response timeout  
- Shared **Gemini translation core** across all three modes  
- Clean thread replies using `chat.postMessage`  


## üíº Use Cases  
- **Global teams** ‚Äì Keep Japanese and English speakers in sync without switching tools.  
- **Project coordination** ‚Äì Use mentions for mixed-language stand-ups and updates.  
- **Announcements** ‚Äì Auto-generate bilingual company posts with `/trans`.  
- **Cross-cultural communication** ‚Äì Help one-language teammates follow along instantly.  


## üí° Perfect for  
- **Global companies** with bilingual or multilingual teams  
- **Startups** collaborating across Japan and Southeast Asia  
- **Developers** exploring Slack + Gemini + n8n automation patterns  


## üß© Notes  
- You can **force a specific translation direction** (JA‚ÜíEN or EN‚ÜíJA) inside the *Code* node.  
- Adjust the system prompt to match tone (‚Äúbusiness-polite‚Äù, ‚Äúcasual‚Äù, etc.).  
- Add glossary replacements for consistent terminology.  
- If the bot doesn‚Äôt respond, ensure your app includes the following scopes:  
  `app_mentions:read`, `chat:write`, `reactions:read`, `channels:history`, and `groups:history`.  
- Always export your workflow with **credentials OFF** before sharing or publishing.  


### ‚ú® Powered by  
**Google Gemini 2.5 Flash** √ó **n8n** √ó **Slack API**  
A complete multilingual layer for your workspace ‚Äî all in one workflow. üåç

workflow.name: Slack Multilingual Assistant with Gemini 2.5 Flash

messageValues.message:
You are a bilingual assistant for a Japanese/English mixed team.
Detect whether the input is mainly Japanese or English.
Return exactly two labeled parts:

[Original]
<the original text>

[Translation]
<the translation in the OTHER language>

Rules:
- Detect source language automatically (JA or EN).
- Translate into the opposite language.
- Do not add explanations or extra comments.
- Keep both blocks in plain text.

parameters.content:
Slack Multilingual Assistant (Gemini 2.5 Flash)

üîß Three translation modes unified in one workflow:
1Ô∏è‚É£ /trans ‚Äî Public bilingual announcements  
‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉFormat: „Äêfrom @user„Äë Original ---------- Translation  
2Ô∏è‚É£ @trans ‚Äî Mention trigger for thread translation (translation only)  
3Ô∏è‚É£ üáØüáµ / üá∫üá∏ Reaction ‚Äî Private on-demand translation  

üí° All modes share the same Google Gemini 2.5 Flash core for automatic JA‚áÑEN detection.

üîß Create and Configure your Slack App (TransBot)

1Ô∏è‚É£ Create App  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí From scratch ‚Üí Name it ‚ÄúTransBot‚Äù ‚Üí Select your workspace  

2Ô∏è‚É£ Add Bot Token Scopes in OAuth & Permissions
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ commands  
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ chat:write  
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ app_mentions:read  
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ reactions:read  
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ channels:history  
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ groups:history (optional for private channels)

3Ô∏è‚É£ Event Subscriptions  
‚ÄÉEnable Events ‚úÖ  
‚ÄÉRequest URL ‚Üí  
‚ÄÉ  https://<your-n8n-domain>/webhook/slack/mention  
‚ÄÉOnce verified, subscribe to bot events:  
‚ÄÉ  ‚Äì app_mention  
‚ÄÉ  ‚Äì message.channels  
‚ÄÉand subscribe on behalf of users:  
‚ÄÉ  ‚Äì reaction_added  

4Ô∏è‚É£ Slash Command  
‚ÄÉCommand name: `/trans`  
‚ÄÉRequest URL ‚Üí  
‚ÄÉ  https://<your-n8n-domain>/webhook/slack/trans  
‚ÄÉShort desc: ‚ÄúTranslate text JA‚áÑEN with Gemini 2.5 Flash‚Äù

5Ô∏è‚É£ Install or Reinstall to Workspace  
‚ÄÉCopy the new Bot User OAuth Token (xoxb-‚Ä¶)  
‚ÄÉand paste it into the HTTP Request headers in n8n  
‚ÄÉ(`Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE`)

6Ô∏è‚É£ Invite the bot to your channels:  
‚ÄÉ`/invite @TransBot`

üîÅ Workflow Architecture

‚Ä¢ Webhooks:
‚ÄÉ ‚Äì /slack/trans     ‚Üí Slash Command  
‚ÄÉ ‚Äì /slack/mention  ‚Üí app_mention & reaction_added events  

‚Ä¢ Language Model: Google Gemini 2.5 Flash  
‚Ä¢ Logic:
‚ÄÉ ‚Äì Detect source language (JA/EN)  
‚ÄÉ ‚Äì Translate to the opposite language  
‚ÄÉ ‚Äì Format Slack message per mode  

‚Ä¢ Outputs:
‚ÄÉ ‚Äì /trans ‚Üí Posts bilingual message to channel (via response_url)  
‚ÄÉ ‚Äì @trans ‚Üí Replies in thread with translation only  
‚ÄÉ ‚Äì Reaction ‚Üí Replies in thread with translation only (for reader)

All three paths share the same Gemini core.

üö® Common Errors & Fixes

‚ùå invalid_auth  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Using an old token or bot not invited to channel  
‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉFix: Reinstall app / use latest xoxb token / `/invite @TransBot`

‚ùå missing_scope  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí A required scope is missing  
‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉFix: Add scope in OAuth & Permissions ‚Üí Save ‚Üí Reinstall

‚ùå no message found  
‚ÄÉ‚Üí Reaction event can‚Äôt fetch original text  
‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉFix: Add `groups:history` scope for private channels

‚úÖ Workflow is Active in n8n  
‚úÖ Slack Event Subscription Request URL shows ‚ÄúVerified ‚úÖ‚Äù  
‚úÖ Bot Token includes chat:write, channels:history, reactions:read  
‚úÖ /trans Slash Command responds with ‚ÄúTranslating...‚Äù then Gemini output  
‚úÖ @trans mention replies in thread with translation only  
‚úÖ üáØüáµ/üá∫üá∏ reaction adds translation reply in thread

nodes.name: Skip Reaction When No Message Found

parameters.jsCode:
const event = $json.body?.event || $json.event;
return [{ json: { event_type: event.type, event } }];

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
